abstract: Carol Giacomo Editorial Observer contends that while coming Saudi Arabia elections in which women will vote and run for office for first time represent step forward for women's rights, barriers still remain to their full participation in society; notes women are still banned from many events where men are present and barred from driving; holds that despite restrictions, examples of female empowerment are blooming outside of politics.
lead_paragraph: Only a fraction of the Saudi women who will be able to vote for the first time in December have registered.

headline.main: In Saudi Arabia, Where Women’s Suffrage Is a New Idea
headline.print_headline: Where Women’s Suffrage Is a New Idea

snippet: Only a fraction of the Saudi women who will be able to vote for the first time in December have registered.
